W wait
 

Initial value:

 function(millis){
    date = new Date();
    var curDate = null;
    do{
        var curDate = new Date();
    }while(curDate-date < millis);
}
Wait.

wait until the delay amount in millisecond passed

Parameters:
millis delay amount in millisecond

Definition at line 34 of file Timer.js.

W test
 

Initial value:

 function(pred, title){
    ++this.numCases;
    if(typeof pred == 'string')
        pred = confirm(pred);
    this.mesg += '<li>Testing "'+ title +'" . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ';
    if(!pred){
        ++this.numErrors;
        this.mesg += '<font color="red"><b>[failed]</b></font></li>';
    }else this.mesg +='<font color="navy"><b>[passed]</b></font></li>';
}
Check a predicate.

examine the predicate and write 'passed.' or 'failed.' along with the test title. If the type of 'pred' the first argument is string, it shows a confirm alert and the result(true/false) become the pred input.

Note:
The reason we are queuing output messages and document.write it at the last is because document.write sometimes erases contents exists already. I couldn't find the cause of this yet.
Parameters:
pred predicate
title the title of this test

W Timer

It can be used along with W.test command.
